docs.lead_paragraph: The decision furthered President Obama’s self-described evolution on same-sex marriage rights as his administration appeared closer to confronting a state over its refusal to recognize such rights.

headline.main: U.S. to Recognize 1,300 Marriages Disputed by Utah
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Recognize 1,300 Marriages Disputed by Utah

docs.abstract: Justice Department announces that federal government will recognize as lawful the marriages of some 1,300 same-sex couples in Utah, despite state government's refusal to do so; move is Obama administration's latest contribution to the fast-moving legal battle over same-sex marriage rights.
docs.snippet: The decision furthered President Obama’s self-described evolution on same-sex marriage rights as his administration appeared closer to confronting a state over its refusal to recognize such rights.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Charlie Savage reported from Washington, and Jack Healy from Denver.
byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and JACK HEALY

docs.lead_paragraph: Fire departments won't have to provide coverage to volunteer firefighters under the federal health care law, the U.S. Department of Treasury said Friday, easing concerns that the overhaul would force departments to slash volunteer hours or benefits.

headline.main: Treasury: Volunteer Firefighters Exempt Under ACA
headline.print_headline: Treasury: Volunteer Firefighters Exempt Under ACA

docs.snippet: Fire departments won't have to provide coverage to volunteer firefighters under the federal health care law, the U.S. Department of Treasury said Friday, easing concerns that the overhaul would force departments to slash volunteer hours or benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 2 million Americans met the health care overhaul's deadline last month to sign up for insurance coverage that started Jan. 1. But the enrollment window hasn't slammed shut on the millions more who still need protection in the new year.

headline.main: 4 Questions to Ask Before Next Overhaul Deadline
headline.print_headline: 4 Questions to Ask Before Next Overhaul Deadline

docs.snippet: More than 2 million Americans met the health care overhaul's deadline last month to sign up for insurance coverage that started Jan. 1. But the enrollment window hasn't slammed shut on the millions more who still need protection in the new year.

docs.abstract: There may be more static than usual in the latest jobs report, but it’s still saying something worth hearing, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: There may be more static than usual in the latest jobs report, but it’s still saying something worth hearing, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government's much-maligned health insurance website is getting a new outside contractor to steer the revamped portal through the remainder of open enrollment season.

headline.print_headline: Feds Won't Renew Health Website's Lead Contractor

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is lunching with five young people to call attention to the need for young Americans to enroll for insurance through his health care law.

headline.print_headline: Obama Lunches With Youth Promoting Health Sign-Ups

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government will part ways next month with contractor CGI Federal over the troubled Obamacare enrollment website, HealthCare.gov, which failed to work when it launched in October for millions of Americans shopping for insurance, the company said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: U.S. to Part With Contractor CGI for Obamacare Website

docs.lead_paragraph: In a move that some fear could compromise care for Medicare recipients, the Obama administration is proposing to remove special protections that guarantee seniors access to a wide selection of three types of prescription drugs.

headline.main: Proposed Medicare Drug Change Stirs Access Worries
headline.print_headline: Proposed Medicare Drug Change Stirs Access Worries

docs.snippet: In a move that some fear could compromise care for Medicare recipients, the Obama administration is proposing to remove special protections that guarantee seniors access to a wide selection of three types of prescription drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. attorney general said Friday that the federal government would recognize same-sex unions in Utah, marking the latest significant show of support for gay marriage from the Obama administration.

headline.main: Feds Recognize Same-Sex Couples in Utah
headline.print_headline: Feds Recognize Same-Sex Couples in Utah

docs.snippet: The U.S. attorney general said Friday that the federal government would recognize same-sex unions in Utah, marking the latest significant show of support for gay marriage from the Obama administration.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives next week will pass a stop-gap funding measure to prevent a government shutdown for three days as negotiators try to finalize a $1 trillion spending bill, Republican Majority Leader Eric Cantor said on Friday.

headline.main: Congress to Pass Stopgap Funding Bill Next Week: Top Republican
headline.print_headline: Congress to Pass Stopgap Funding Bill Next Week: Top Republican

docs.snippet: The House of Representatives next week will pass a stop-gap funding measure to prevent a government shutdown for three days as negotiators try to finalize a $1 trillion spending bill, Republican Majority Leader Eric Cantor said on Friday.
